intro: Hemitelia hemichlamydea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
